medical_history.chief_complaint: 12 hours of left lower quadrant (LLQ) pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The LLQ pain began suddenly at 8 PM the night before, described as sharp and unrelenting in severity. The patient took Advil at 1 AM, which provided some relief, but the pain persisted until she presented to the ED at 7:30 AM. There were no accompanying symptoms such as fever, chills, nausea or vomiting, diarrhea, or constipation.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Colon polyps (benign appearance), diverticulosis of the sigmoid colon, grade 1 internal hemorrhoids, hypertension (treated with Lisinopril), migraines.
medical_history.family_history: Mother with unknown condition, died of primary glioma; daughter and father alive and well; maternal uncle deceased from spinal cancer; maternal uncle deceased from lung cancer.
